title.narrative: Center for Investigative Journalism 2020-2023, core support
Center för Undersökande Journalistik 2020-2023, core support

description.narrative: CIN is not using the concept of Theory of Change but its equivalent is defined below. CIN's Vision and Mission ultimate goal is to make sure CIN stories empower citizens, civil society and honest government representatives in BiH to request change and educate them to actively participate in democratic processes. CIN's Impact results identifies: Legal and institutional framework needs to be improved in order to eradicate corruption and enable equal access to rights/justice for all citizens. In order to do this CIN has identified two main Outcome level results, that are further delineated to sub-outcomes and bridging outcome levels as portrayed in the Result Assessment Framework (RAF) they produced.Outcome I is identified in the following manner: People have access to accurate information about the corruption in public sector. Under this outcome CIN hope to achieve the following important results by the end of 2023: i) increase the production of stories to 35 per annum, ii) increase the number of audience on different platforms by 30%, iii) increase the number of stories developed by audience's interest to 20%, and iv) develop at least 10 stories as a result of engagement with the audience.Outcome II is formulated in the following manner: Public officials prompted to prevent and tackle corruption. Under this outcome CIN plans to engage more closely with CSOs and other relevant actors from the professional public in order to excert pressure on authorities and institutions to respond to corruption findings, and work to decrease the possibilities for corruption and abuse of power to reoccur by improving legal framework and institutional response. As part of and in order for CIN to deliver its strategic objectives, the organisation has set three key priority areas for development and those are the following; Goal I) To advance its capacities to audience and monitor audience behaviors, Goal II) To enhance editorial convergence and improve competences to interact with the targeted audiences and Goal III) To diversify sources of income. CIN's stakeholders are General audience (BiH, regionally and Diaspora) and the prime targets groups of CIN's stories are to 75% between the ages of 25-55 years. Journalists, Media outlets, Civil Society Organisations and national decision makers and state institutions. As for the youth audience CIN which is less than 10%, CIN is not formulating messages specifically for that group but are considering them as part of their audience for sure. At the end of the intervention CIN as a media organisation hope that by informing general public accurately and fairly about corruption, organised crime and system deficiencies will inspire citizens (of BiH) to action, to initiate government to increase accountability and to promote standards of investigative reporting.

CIN's Vision and Mission ultimate goal is to make sure CIN stories empower citizens, civil society and honest government representatives in BiH to request change and educate them to actively participate in democratic processes.
CIN's Impact results identifies: Legal and institutional framework needs to be improved in order to eradicate corruption and enable equal access to rights/justice for all citizens. In order to do this CIN has indentified two main Outcome level results, that are further delineated to sub-outcomes and bridgeing outcome levels as portrayed in the Result Assessment Framework (RAF) they produced.
Outcome I is identified in the following manner: People have access to accurate information about the corruption in public sector. Under this outcome CIN hope to achieve the following important results by the end of 2023: i) increase the production of stories to 35 per annum, ii) increase the number of audience on different platforms by 30%, iii) increase the number of stories developed by audience's interest to 20%, and iv) develop at least 10 stories as a result of engagement with the audience.
Outcome II is formulated in the following manner: Public officials prompted to prevent and tackle corruption. Under this outcome CIN plans to engage more closely with CSOs and other relevant actors from the professional public in order to excert pressure on authorities and institutions to respond to corruption findings, and work to decrease the possibilities for corruption and abuse of power to reoccur by improving legal framework and institutional response.
As part of and in order for CIN to deliver its strategic objectives, the organisation has set three key priority areas for development and those are the following; Goal I) To advance its capacities to audience and monitor audience behaviors, Goal II) To enhance editorial convergence and improve competences to interact with the targeted audiences and Goal III) To diversify sources of income.

CIN:s vision och mission och dess långsiktiga målsättning är att säkerställa att CIN journalistiska artiklar ger människor ökad kunskap och makt, och att civilsamhället och genuina offentliga beslutsfattare i Bosnien-Hercegovina (hädanefter BIH) är aktiva och deltar i politiska processer med syfte att förändringar samhället till det bättre.
CIN:s övergripande resultatmål har identifierats enligt följande: legala och institutionella ramverk måste förbättras i syfte att bekämpa korruption samt och söka ge lika rättigheter och tillgång till rättvisa för alla medborgare (s.k. säkerställa rättsstatens funktion). För att kunna uppnå dessa ambitiösa mål har CIN indentifierat och brutit ned detta övergripande mål i två huvudsakliga resultatmål och som sedan i sin tur definierats i undermålsättningar samt i s.k överbryggande målsättningar. Dessa finns återspeglade i det resultatramverk som CIN framtagit.
Övergripande resultatmål nr. I identifieras enligt följande: Människor ges tillgång till tillförlitlig information om korruption som emanerar från den offentliga sektorn. Under denna resultatmål hoppas CIN kunna uppnå följande viktiga resultat under 2023: i) ett ökat antal artiklar per år, till 35, ii) ökat antal av besökare till CIN:s olika digitala plattformar med 30%, iii) ökat antal artiklar som utvecklats p.g.a. och genom publikens intresse, med 20%, samt iv) utveckla minst 10 artiklar som ett resultat av direkt engagement med CIN:s publik och dess läsarkrets.
Övergripande resultatmål nr. II identifieras enligt följande: Statliga och andra offentliganställda representanter påverkas att stoppa och motarbeta korruption. Som del av denna målsättning planerar CIN att engagera sig än mera med civilsamhälles organisationer samt andra relevanta aktörers i syfte att gemensam utöva ökat tryck på myndigheter och institutioner, samt kräva dessa på svar/åtgärder när korruption uppdagats. Det handlat även om att ökat samarbeta mellan parter för att minska möjligheter till korruption och missbruk dels genom förbättrad lagstiftning dels genom institutionell respons.
Som en del av CIN:s arbete att kunna leverera dessa strategiska målsättningar; har organisationen angett tre centrala prioriteringar att utveckla som är följande; Mål I) att stärka kapaciteten vis-a-vis dess publik och åhörare, samt att mäta mottagarnas mottaglighet och agerande, Mål II) att förbättra CIN:s redaktionell samspel samt förbättra kompetensen hur man skall agera i relation till sina åhörare samt Mål III) att utveckla långsiktig finansiering av den journalistiska verksamheten.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

description.narrative: The annual report is the first in another/renewed 3 years of Swedish core support to CIN Strategy Plan. The report is well structured and follows the overall success indicators which CIN established in its strategic plan 2020-2023.These are:By the end of 2023 CIN hopes to:-Increase the production of stories to 35 per year-Increase the number of audience on different platforms by 30%-Increase the number of stories developed by audience’s interest to 20%-Develop at least 10 stories as a result of engagement with the audience Simultaneously, CIN plans to further strengthen its capacities to deliver to its strategic objectives and diversify sources of income. Notable results in 2020 are as follows: -Total of 44 stories (24 investigative stories and 20 follow up/short stories) were published in 2020. The multimedia newsroom produced 17 video stories and 33 short videos / animations, 109 infographics, 6 photo galleries and 12 profiles in support of each story.-Three major databases were also created and published (on foreign investors land ownerships-improving the transparency of investors from Middle East, on natural resources protected areas, and on incentives for electricity generated from hydro)-Asset declaration databases on politicians (200 profiles) and judicial office holders (some 40 profiles) were continually updated. It can be assessed that CIN's audience measurement results indicate a steady increase. When looking at the age distribution, CIN is remaining high in number of “young” audience: 75% of its visitors are in age categories of 25-54, with about 30% between 25-34. Gender balance is remaining in favor of women, with 54.5% of our visitors being women. CIN's FB followers are continuously increasing and currently stand at 61.058 followers (22.80% increase) Due to its large presence on social media, CIN is receiving a lot of tips from citizens (citizen engagement). From about 1 200 tips, about 200 were filtered for possible investigation and 9 stories were published based on those investigations. The budget is 57% realized against plan for 2020. Most of the unrealized costs relate to staff (journalists leaving) and this is mentioned in the narrative report. The situation is seen to improve in 2021.The work plan report follows the narrative report structure, only in more detail activities. Most activities are reported to have taken place as planned. Delayed activities (due to pandemic) include those related to the objective of finding diversified sources of income. These activities have been moved to 2021 plan. The work plan and budget were submitted for 2021 well ahead of time. The activities are detailed and follow the previous work plan structure as well as the format. Based on the above, it is assessed that CIN is meeting the majority of its strategy plan indicators.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
